transcripts.message:
(Page 4 of 7)
STATE OF INDIANA,)
)ss.
County of Dearborn,)

On this 26th day of March A.D. one thousand eight hundred and fifty five personally appeared before me Sackville H. Gunn, Clerk of the Dearborn Circuit Court within and for said County, John M. Dustan aged seventy three years, a resident of Aurora, in said County and State, who being duly sworn according to law, doth on his oath declare that he served as a private soldier in the Army of the United States during the Revolutionary War under Captain Samuel McConnell in the Company commanded by Lieutenant John Neal in the 10th Virginia Regiment commanded by Colonel William Campbell; that he continued to serve as such soldier until discharged at Charlottesville, Virginia on or about the first day of January one thousand seven hundred and eighty two. He further declares that he has no documentary evidence of his service, but that he is firmly convinced from recollection of events and conversations with his former comrades in arms that he is entitled to a pension for such services as above stated; that he was born on the 26th day of December one thousand seven hundred and eighty one in Amherst County, Virginia, and that he has resided in said Aurora since the year one thousand eight hundred and thirty nine.

JOHN M. DUSTAN

We, William W. Hays and Samuel McClellan, residents of Aurora, Dearborn County, Indiana, hereby certify that we are well acquainted with John M. Dustan who has subscribed and sworn to the above declaration; that he is seventy three years of age, and that he is reputed and believed in our neighborhood to have been a soldier of the Revolution, and that we concur in that opinion.

WILLIAM W. HAYS
SAMUEL McCLELLAN

Sworn to and subscribed before me this 26th day of March A.D. one thousand eight hundred and fifty five, and I hereby certify that the contents of the above declaration and certificate were fully made known to the deponent before the signing thereof, and that he signed and acknowledged the same in my presence, and that I believe from his appearance and statement that he is the person he represents himself to be.

SACKVILLE H. GUNN, Clerk Dearborn Circuit Court.
